body_html:
I think it's because the graph grows. There is no simple way to prove there graph. You can reset the graph. May I suggest you take a look at the tf.contrib.dataset?
…
On Sep 4, 2017 10:17 PM, "Penghao Cen" ***@***.***> wrote: @eaplatanios <https://github.com/eaplatanios> @drpngx <https://github.com/drpngx> Sorry to comment on this closed issue, but I have a similar problem as code shown below: with tf.Session() as sess: for i in range(0, 1000): fread = tf.read_file('./data.text') sess.run(fread) In the loop, memory consumption will increase time by time. My question is how to free this tf.Tensor(fread) explicit? Could you take a look please, Thanks! — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. body_text:
I think it's because the graph grows. There is no simple way to prove there
graph. You can reset the graph.

May I suggest you take a look at the tf.contrib.dataset?
…
On Sep 4, 2017 10:17 PM, "Penghao Cen" ***@***.***> wrote:
 @eaplatanios <https://github.com/eaplatanios> @drpngx
 <https://github.com/drpngx> Sorry to comment on this closed issue, but I
 have a similar problem as code shown below:

 with tf.Session() as sess:
     for i in range(0, 1000):
         fread = tf.read_file('./data.text')
         sess.run(fread)

 In the loop, memory consumption will increase time by time.

 My question is how to free this tf.Tensor(fread) explicit?
 Could you take a look please, Thanks!

 —

body:
I think it's because the graph grows. There is no simple way to prove there
graph. You can reset the graph.

May I suggest you take a look at the tf.contrib.dataset?

On Sep 4, 2017 10:17 PM, "Penghao Cen" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @eaplatanios <https://github.com/eaplatanios> @drpngx
> <https://github.com/drpngx> Sorry to comment on this closed issue, but I
> have a similar problem as code shown below:
>
> with tf.Session() as sess:
>     for i in range(0, 1000):
>         fread = tf.read_file('./data.text')
>         sess.run(fread)
>
> In the loop, memory consumption will increase time by time.
>
> My question is how to free this tf.Tensor(fread) explicit?
> Could you take a look please, Thanks!
>
